intro: Gymnanthes widgrenii, commonly known as the narrow-leafed huito, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which is characterized by its latex-producing structures and diverse morphological features. The plant typically grows to a height of 5-10 meters, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a smooth margin. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, clustered in cyathia, a unique floral structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
